revised_title: The Troughton Family and Their Contributions to Mathematical Instrument Making
tldr: This article provides a detailed account of the Troughton family, particularly John and Edward Troughton, who were prominent mathematical instrument makers in 18th and early 19th century England. The authors discuss their methods, contributions, and the instruments they created, which hold an important place in the history of astronomy, geodetic surveying, and metrology. The article also corrects some inaccuracies and misconceptions in the traditional narrative of the Troughton family's story.
